div.l: For ale ⁊and bred ⁊and rostede hēm a goos
And bond here hors it schulde not gon loos
And in hese owene chaūmbir made a bed
With schetis ⁊and with chaloıı̄unnys fayre I spred
Not frōm his owene bed ten fote or twelve
Hese douȝtyr hadde a bed al by here selue
Rygh in þe same schaūmbyr by ⁊and by
It myȝte ben no bet ⁊and cause why
There was non roumere herberw īn þe plase
The soupe ⁊and þey speke hēm to solase
And dronkȳn ay strong ale at þe beste
Aboute medenyȝt wente þey to reste
Wel hath this mellere vernychid hese hed
Ful pale he was for drunke ⁊and not red
He ȝyksneth ⁊and spekyth þoᵘurw þe nose
As he were on þe quakke or on þe pose
To bedde he goþ ⁊and with hȳm goth his wif
As ony iay sche lyȝt was ⁊and iolyf
So was here ioly whistele wel I wet
The cradil at here beddys feet is set
To rokke ⁊and to ȝeue þe child to souke
And whān þᵗat dronkȳn al was in þᵉ crouke
To bedde wēnte þe douȝtyr ryȝt a non
To bedde goth aleȳn ⁊and ek Iohn
Ther nas no mor hēm neded no dwale
This mellere hath so wysely bibbit alle
That as an hors he snortyth in hese slep
Ne of hese tayl ne takyth he no kep
Hese wif bar hȳm a burdoıı̄un a ful strong
Men myȝtȳn here hyre route too furlōng
The wenche routyth ek ꝑpar cūmpaynye
Aleyn þe clerk þᵗat herde þis melodye
He pokede ion ⁊and seyde slepist þᵘou
Herdist þᵘou euere swich a song er now
Lo swich a copil is a mong hēm alle
A wylde fyr mote on here bodyis falle
